results.title: Pony Club
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of the Merriwa Pony Club. Memberships of this club totals 300 boys ad girls, all under 18, who spend their leisure hours roaming the cattle and sheep country of New South Wales. Club activities include herding and tending cattle, race, camping trips, visits to famous stud farms and show riding, leading to participation in the Royal Easter Show.
results.description: Shows the activities of the Merriwa Pony Club. results.title: Perth
results.creator_credit: Henry Lewes, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
A pictorial story with minimum commentary on the city of Perth. The daily newspaper is used as the medium to reflect, social, business and sporting activities of the average Australian family living in the city of Perth.

results.title: Painting people
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Six Australian artists - William Dobell, Russell Drysdale, Clifton Pugh, William Dargie, Jan Molvig and Andrew Sibley - discuss the problems of portraiture, including paintings of Tom Roberts and Arthur Streeton.

holdings.name: MOV file H264; ACMI Digital Access Copy - presentation

results.title: The Opening of Canberra, Australia's capital city
results.brief_description: Shows the arrival of the Duke and Duchess of York at Parliament House. They are welcomed by the Governor-General, Lord Stonehaven and the Prime Minister, Mr. S.M. Bruce. The guard of honour is inspected and the Royal visitors are escorted into the Senate Chamber. There are also scenes of a parade of 3,000 troops and a body of returned soldiers.

The guard of honour is inspected and the Royal visitors are escorted into the Senate Chamber. There are also scenes of a parade of 3,000 troops and a body of returned soldiers.

results.title: One man's road
results.creator_credit: Robert Kingsbury, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The life of a First Nations family in reserves, country situations and Sydney. Clive and Ida Williams recall the disadvantages typical of most Aborigines’ lives in New South Wales which prevent full participation in society, and their building a successful life in the city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Kingsbury, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: One for the road
results.creator_credit: Dennis A. Hill and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A few hours in the life of Bill Smith show why you should not mix drinking with driving. The affect of alcohol is illustrated with a model brain: although not drunk Smith’s brain power was sufficiently impaired to cause a fatal accident.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis A. Hill and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Nullarbor hideout
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, John Martin-Jones, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The adventures of a group of children living at Cook on the Nullarbor Plain. They discover a swimming pool in a limestone cave and make the cave their hide-out. The children become involved with kangaroo shooters who are wanted by police for car stealing. Cast includes Tom Burstall, Betty Burstall, David Crocker, Frances Hatham, Marcus Skipper.
